A woman who allegedly filmed herself urinating on the Koran before burning it and declaring war on Muslim 'parasites' faces six years in jail. 
The woman was identified as Sheila Szmerekova, 24, from the central Slovakian city of Ruzomberok after the video sparked outrage on social media. 
In the video, a woman is seen standing in front of the Slovak national flag with the Muslim holy book which she insults, urinates on and then sets alight. 
A Special Court in Banska Bystrica ruled she would be kept in custody before facing trial. Read More Sheila Szmerekova is accused of setting fire to the Koran (Photo: CEN/Facebook) Szmerekova covered her face as she entered court (Photo: CEN/TV Markiza) 
Szmerekova is accused of creating extremist promotional materials, defamation of a nation and race and incitement of national, racial or ethnic hatred. 
According to spokeswoman of the general prosecutor's office Andrea Predajnova, the video was shared online in December 2016. 
A police spokeswoman described the video: "In the video she shows a book with the title The Quran and she repeatedly said that it was the Quran. Read More Jolie speaks out over Koran burning The woman rips pages out of the holy book and sets it on fire (Photo: Youtube/Activiton User) After holding the book up to the camera, the woman squats down and urinates on it (Photo: Youtube/Activiton User) 
"She tore out the pages and threw them on the ground. She urinated on the pages and wiped herself with some, and then she set them on fire." 
The woman in the video refers to Muslims while saying: "I will hunt you all step by step. No matter if it is a woman, a child or a man. I will bump off anybody who gets in my way. 
"I do not care about the criminal complaints. It will not stop me. I have a message for everybody, including the police - nobody will stop me." Like us on Facebook
